section.title: Requirements
section.para: Building Debian Live images has very few system requirements:

listitem.para: A POSIX-compliant shell, such as bash or dash.

section.para: Note that using Debian or a Debian-derived distribution is not required - live-helper will run on almost any operating system with the above requirements.

section.title: Installing live-helper
section.para: You can install live-helper in a number of different ways:
If you are using lenny or sid the recommended way is to install live-helper via the Debian repository.

section.para: Simply install live-helper like any other package:

section.screen: $ cd live-helper $ dpkg-buildpackage -rfakeroot -b -uc -us $ cd .. # dpkg -i live-helper*.deb

section.title: From 'snapshots'
section.para: If you do not wish to build or install live-helper from source, you can use snapshots. These are built automatically from the latest version in Git and are available on http://live.debian.net/debian.

para.emphasis: N.B. You do not need to install live-initramfs on your system to create customised Debian Live systems. However, doing so will do no harm.

You must build either on your target distribution or in a chroot containing your target platform: this means if your target is lenny then you should build against lenny.
